content.description: This is the leftmost route on the wall, it starts at a small overhang. Get your feat on the slab and follow the bolt line to the top
content.location: Same approach for No Eyed Dear/Bees Crack. Leftmost of the bolted slab routes.

content.description: Climb the long slab left of a left-facing corner to a two bolt anchor.
content.protection: 4 bolts and some gear. Two bolt anchor at the top, with rap rings.
content.location:
After leaving the Long Trail, follow the climbers' trail as it passes the Taboo Crack area. Continue underneath an impressive, though short and chossy, overhanging cliff. After passing under the cliff, turn left and head steeply uphill. Bear left when the trail forks and hike about hundred feet to a flat base. (All info pulled from Tough Schist)

 You can also rap down from the anchors of the next two routes to the left.

content.description: Climb the steep face passing three bolts and a stark crux that requires good route-finding to stay at the grade. Continue above the face on gear to the fixed anchor.
content.location:
15 ft left of Bee's Crack 

Descent: Rap from the fixed anchor.

content.description: This is the bolted, easy slab to the left of No Eyed Dear. Follow the bolt line up, beginning with 5.5 slab moves until you gain a big jug. The grade eases from here. Make your way up to the lower off anchors.
content.location: Take the long trail from the Prospect Parking Lot until you spot the climbers trail, follow it past Taboo Crack and an overhang until you see the bolted slab wall. This is the second route here.

content.description: climb up the face passing bolts to a large flake, pull over and continue to the top.
content.location: one route left of still no eyed deer

content.description: climb the short bit of buldging rock next to bee's crack on the right passing a bolt and a few horizontal cracks to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: 1 bolt, 0.2-0.75 cams, nuts if you want

content.description:
Bee's Crack takes the obvious jagged crack line on the right side of this section. The protection is trickier than it looks from the ground as the crack is more complex up close. Sadly the crack isn't 90 ft longer! 

  Once the crack has been dispatched climb blocks (3" piece) up and slightly left to the shared anchor with Insecticide.
content.protection: Stoppers and small to medium sized gear and a 3" piece.
content.location: Descent: Rappel from the shared anchor with Insecticide.

content.description: A large assortment of easy to moderate climbs. More shaded by trees.
